abstract: “The Oval Offices” shows how replicas of the nation’s seat of power — found everywhere from presidential libraries to even an airport — reflect the tastes and quirks of its occupants.

keywords.value: Truman, Harry S, Library and Museum
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Every modern president makes a distinct mark on the look of the Oval Office, the most powerful room in the country. But the impact is temporary; it tends to fade shortly after the room’s next occupant arrives. As a result, every president since Gerald Ford has sought to preserve his decorative influence with a replica of the Oval Office at their presidential library.
snippet: “The Oval Offices” shows how replicas of the nation’s seat of power — found everywhere from presidential libraries to even an airport — reflect the tastes and quirks of its occupants....
